posts.post_content: The worst leech IMO...the only way to use him on the battlefield effectively is to have lots of black mana, and the only way to use black mana effectively is to play black spells, and the only way to play black spells effectively is to not run Andradite Leech.
posts.html:
The worst leech IMO...the only way to use him on the battlefield effectively is to have lots of black mana, and the only way to use black mana effectively is to play black spells, and the only way to play black spells effectively is to not run Andradite Leech.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: JenBroness (12/20/2010 7:49:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: While I definitely wouldn't call it good, or even adequate, the idea is interesting. Unlike the other leeches it provides an alternate use for the black mana you aren't using to cast black spells, and black will probably have an easier time sacrificing it when it has worn out its welcome than most colours. If it was bigger to start with or gave a better payoff as a mana sink (perhaps gaining +1/+1 counters instead of just until EOT), it might be worth using.
posts.html:
While I definitely wouldn't call it good, or even adequate, the idea is interesting. Unlike the other leeches it provides an alternate use for the black mana you aren't using to cast black spells, and black will probably have an easier time sacrificing it when it has worn out its welcome than most colours. If it was bigger to start with or gave a better payoff as a mana sink (perhaps gaining +1/+1 counters instead of just until EOT), it might be worth using.

posts.post_content: Good for [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze). Use [Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp) for your discard outlet and just bin this guy to give your ooze flying and then use this ability to pump the ooze. Sure, there are others, but you want 8-12 of those in your deck since it's one of the most useful abilities to give to [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze).

posts.post_content: Actually this card is a lot better than anyone has apparently realized. Consider this- on your 4th or 5th turn you have played a pretty solid wall or defensive creature to defend yourself effectively and have accumulated 4 or 5 swamps. You lay down Andradite Leech and your opponent laughs hysterically at how idiotic you are because of its obvious drawback. Next turn you power up the leech a bit (NOT TOO MUCH!) and attack. Suddenly the opponent has a major quandary on their hands: toast the leech with a spell or otherwise destroy it with a blocker, or let the 3/3 or 4/4 leech through. This seems like an easy decision until you realize that if they kill it, now you can play spells just as easily as normal, and possibly have cooked something up in the time since playing the leech, OR they let the leech through and take the damage in order to keep you at a disadvantage when playing spells. In the end they will probably let it through at least once or twice before they realize that you've d... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
